attributes.action: Teach children about the realities of British Imperialism and Colonialism
attributes.additional_details: If we can educate young people about the true horrors of racism from a young age and ensure they can understand why it is wrong then racism in the country will inevitably die out, education is a key step to ensuring racism is a thing of the past.
attributes.background: Change the curriculum to ensure that all students understand the reality of imperialism and colonialism for example treatment of BAME people, transportation of BAME people, renaming of African countries, dividing of nations and also the after effects of leaving these nations with no government

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
